Description: Small fragment perhaps from neck of North Ionian pottery vessel; interior glazed; exterior black glaze fired brown in parts, though this may be part possibly part of decoration; traces of white slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in: D. G. Hogarth, H. L. Lorimer & C. C. Edgar, Naukratis 1903, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 25 (1905), p. 116, fig. 2, no. 10.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 707, no. 653)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2069)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
